message: duostack.com is going pretty strong
duostack is both ruby and node, and it is hard to compete against heroku
Is there something like Heroku out there but cheaper?
That's why Heroku is such a compelling product.  It's not price, it's features+simplicity
most of the hosting goes towards node.js though, this is where the action is in 2011, especially now that vm ware has entered the game
argh, grammar....
duostack hasn't priced yet, but they need to be lower priced than heroku
Not necessarily.  If they are a NodeJS shop, they just need to be the cheapest Node hosting provider
The Node angle gives them some leeway on pricing
and it is simpleworker.com -- sorry -- in dire need of coffee :)
What's the pricing for Duostack?
I'm sure there are, but you end up sacrificing features for the price
yes, totally agree. And the peace of mind. Not having to worry that the platform is running... what a relief
Is there something like Heroku out there but cheaper?
Own your own server through something like Linode or Slicehost
Which is why they're angling themselves as BOTH Node and Ruby
Yeah, when you have to compete directly on price, you end up playing against people like Amazon who can just outmaneuver you on it.
Frankly I fear they will face an uphill battle unless they come up with a completely different pricing strategy, for example what simple_worker.com is doing for background processing
http://www.simpleworker.com/
reminds me of http://www.picloud.com/
duostack's price is here: http://docs.duostack.com/ruby/paid-features
I'm using a zerigo VPS with Node.js now. Wouldn't have found out about them without Heroku. :)
hmm, I found this on google and thought it might be an interesting thread. then I saw that I was the last one to post to it. lol
there is also cloundfoundry.org,you can install from source or there is an ubuntu ppa
Has anyone use these other options? I would to hear feedback on cloud foundry

Heroku isnt that expensive but its nice to have alternitives
